Articles.Content:
My medium sized Interplanetary module with a fully functioning refuel station and an extra fuel tank, I will later send the crew module to make it my first Duna station. Once the Remaining modules arrive the engine module will be removed and I don't have a plan for them just yet but I'm certainly not going to let them go to waste.

I use KAS, KW Rocketry, B9 Aerospace, and Kethane.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited January 16, 2014 by JTDismang

I was realy curious but theres only one pic that isn't in total darkness. The sunlight is your freind during photo ops.

Also, Use F2 to hide all the Interface stuff.
Yeah the spacecraft always seems brighter when I take the screenshot lol and thanks for telling me how to remove the interface.
Isn't a mobile space station called "a ship"?

Isn't a mobile space station called "a ship"?

Yup. Some science fiction, such as Star Wars, state that a "capital ship" is any ship longer than 100 ft (it may have been meters). Modern day definition simply refers to a primary ship of a battlegroup as a capital ship. I'm partial to the Star Wars definition. So if this "mobile station" is longer than 100 ft (or 33 m), then I would say that it should be classified as a "capital ship."

Lol ok its a multi-purpose delivery vehicle with a space station attached then xD

Edited January 17, 2014 by JTDismang
